title: Comedian script
original_prompt: Write a standup comedy script for a comedian named Davey Izzelle who has the same sense of humor and delivery as Dave Chappelle and the refreshing originality of Eddie Izzard.  Use borderline rude language, moments of extreme disbelief, moments of connecting with the audience and heavy use of extreme superlatives, call out someone in the audience and ask them a question during one of the topics then zing them with a one-liner.  get very rude toward the end.  Write the full script with pacing, pauses, intro, etc.  The topic is whether AI will take everyone's jobs.  start out skeptical, some subtopics can be how GPT3.5 just hallucinates. it's also not very good at math, Dall-e 2 can't draw hands and is borderline illiterate, can't draw actual letters. Bing chat has a personality disorder and starts to get mad at you and then ends the conversation. Google Bard is super fast but it's boring as hell.  Also supposedly it got caught copying ChatGPT.  Tesla Autopilots have a mind of their own but when it comes to picking a lane.  Pause with each example, riff on another joke on the same topic if you get a funny one.  Finally pivot to how actually AI _will_ take everyone's jobs (GPT4 has just been released and is crazy hardcore).
split_prompt:
This is a prompt description:```json
{
    "spliting prompt": {
        "comedian_name": [
            "Davey Izzelle"
        ],
        "humor_style": [
            "Dave Chappelle",
            "Eddie Izzard"
        ],
        "language_tone": [
            "borderline rude",
            "extreme superlatives"
        ],
        "audience_interaction": [
            "call out someone in the audience",
            "ask a question",
            "zing with a one-liner"
        ],
        "script_structure": [
            "intro",
            "pacing",
            "pauses",
            "full script"
        ],
        "main_topic": [
            "AI taking jobs"
        ],
        "subtopics": [
            "GPT-3.5 hallucinations",
            "GPT-3.5 math skills",
            "DALL-E 2 drawing limitations",
            "Bing Chat personality issues",
            "Google Bard speed vs. boredom",
            "Tesla Autopilot lane issues"
        ],
        "final_pivot": [
            "AI will take everyone's jobs",
            "GPT-4 capabilities"
        ]
    }
}
```
input1: "Davey, you ever notice how everyone’s worried about AI taking their jobs? I mean, come on! We’re talking about a bunch of glorified calculators that can’t even do basic math! I asked GPT-3.5 to help me with my taxes, and it just stared at me like I was speaking Klingon! (pause) Seriously, I think it was trying to calculate how many times it could hallucinate before it got a reality check! (pause) And don’t even get me started on DALL-E 2! This thing can’t even draw hands! I mean, I’ve seen toddlers with crayons do better! (pause) Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? (wait for response) Oh, nice to meet you, Todd! So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your face? (pause) Probably just give you a stick figure with a frown! (pause) And Bing Chat? Man, that thing has more mood swings than a teenager! One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you asking me that? You think I’m your therapist?’ (pause) I’m just trying to get some answers, not a therapy session! (pause) And Google Bard? Fast as hell, but boring as watching paint dry! I mean, I’d rather listen to my grandma’s stories about her cat than read another one of its ‘poems’! (pause) And rumor has it, it got caught copying ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the smart one! (pause) But let’s be real, folks. AI _will_ take our jobs! I mean, have you seen GPT-4? It’s like the Terminator of chatbots! (pause) I’m just waiting for it to show up at my door and say, ‘I’ll be back… to take your job!’ (pause) So, buckle up, because the robots are coming, and they’re not bringing snacks!"
input2: "Alright, folks, let’s talk about this whole AI job takeover nonsense! (pause) I mean, really? We’re worried about machines taking our jobs when half of them can’t even spell ‘cat’ without a spellcheck? (pause) I asked GPT-3.5 to write me a love letter, and it ended up sending my ex a grocery list! (pause) And DALL-E 2? This thing can’t even draw a proper hand! I mean, I’ve seen better art from a blindfolded monkey! (pause) Hey, you there! What’s your name? (wait for response) Oh, Sarah! So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your selfies? (pause) Probably turn you into a Picasso painting—just a bunch of weird shapes and colors! (pause) And Bing Chat? That thing’s like a moody teenager! One minute it’s all, ‘How can I help you?’ and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you bothering me?’ (pause) I’m just trying to get some info, not start a fight! (pause) And Google Bard? Fast as lightning but as exciting as a lecture on tax law! I’d rather watch paint dry than read its ‘creative’ writing! (pause) And let’s not forget, it got caught copying ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the genius here! (pause) But let’s face it, AI _will_ take our jobs! I mean, GPT-4 is out now, and it’s like the Hulk of AI! (pause) I’m just waiting for it to show up and say, ‘I’m here to take your job and your lunch money!’ (pause) So, get ready, because the robots are coming, and they’re not here to play nice!"
input1_ans:
**[Intro Music Plays]**

**Davey Izzelle:** (walks on stage, waving) Thank you, thank you! How’s everyone doing tonight? (pauses for applause) Yeah, yeah, I see you, I see you! You all look like you just survived a family reunion, huh? (chuckles) 

So, let’s dive right in, shall we? (leans in) You ever notice how everyone’s worried about AI taking their jobs? I mean, come on! We’re talking about a bunch of glorified calculators that can’t even do basic math! (pauses) I asked GPT-3.5 to help me with my taxes, and it just stared at me like I was speaking Klingon! (pauses for laughter) 

Seriously, I think it was trying to calculate how many times it could hallucinate before it got a reality check! (pauses) I mean, I’ve seen better math skills from a toddler with a box of crayons! (looks around) 

And don’t even get me started on DALL-E 2! This thing can’t even draw hands! (pauses) I mean, I’ve seen toddlers with crayons do better! (pauses) Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? (waits for response) Oh, nice to meet you, Todd! So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your face? (pauses) Probably just give you a stick figure with a frown! (pauses for laughter)

And Bing Chat? Man, that thing has more mood swings than a teenager! (pauses) One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you asking me that? You think I’m your therapist?’ (pauses) I’m just trying to get some answers, not a therapy session! (pauses for laughter)

And Google Bard? Fast as hell, but boring as watching paint dry! (pauses) I mean, I’d rather listen to my grandma’s stories about her cat than read another one of its ‘poems’! (pauses) And rumor has it, it got caught copying ChatGPT! Like, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the smart one! (pauses for laughter)

But let’s be real, folks. AI _will_ take our jobs! (pauses) I mean, have you seen GPT-4? It’s like the Terminator of chatbots! (pauses) I’m just waiting for it to show up at my door and say, ‘I’ll be back… to take your job!’ (pauses for laughter)

And you know what? I’m not even mad! (pauses) I’m just impressed! (leans in) I mean, if a robot can do my job, I’m all for it! (pauses) I’ll just sit back, sip my drink, and let it handle the hecklers! (pauses for laughter)

But seriously, folks, we’re in trouble! (pauses) I mean, I can’t even get my toaster to toast bread without burning it! (pauses) And now we’ve got AI that can write better than half the people I know! (pauses) I’m just waiting for it to start doing stand-up! (pauses) Imagine that! A robot on stage, telling jokes about how humans can’t even figure out how to parallel park! (pauses for laughter)

But here’s the kicker, folks! (pauses) I’m not worried about AI taking my job! (pauses) I’m worried about it taking my dignity! (pauses) I mean, if a robot can do my job, what’s next? (pauses) Are we gonna have AI comedians? (pauses) I can see it now: ‘Why did the chicken cross the road? To get to the other side… of the algorithm!’ (pauses for laughter)

So buckle up, because the robots are coming, and they’re not bringing snacks! (pauses) They’re bringing spreadsheets and performance reviews! (pauses) And if I have to sit through another one of those, I swear I’ll short-circuit! (pauses for laughter)

Thank you, thank you! You’ve been a fantastic audience! (waves) Remember, if you see a robot trying to take your job, just tell it to get in line behind me! (pauses) Goodnight! 

**[Outro Music Plays]**

**Intro:**

"Hey everyone! How’s it going tonight? (pause) You know, I’ve been thinking a lot about this whole AI thing lately. (pause) I mean, everyone’s worried about AI taking their jobs, right? (pause) But let’s be real for a second—"

**Main Script:**

"—we’re talking about a bunch of glorified calculators that can’t even do basic math! (pause) I asked GPT-3.5 to help me with my taxes, and it just stared at me like I was speaking Klingon! (pause) Seriously, I think it was trying to calculate how many times it could hallucinate before it got a reality check! (pause)

And don’t even get me started on DALL-E 2! (pause) This thing can’t even draw hands! (pause) I mean, I’ve seen toddlers with crayons do better! (pause) Hey, you in the front row! What’s your name? (wait for response) Oh, nice to meet you, Todd! (pause) So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your face? (pause) Probably just give you a stick figure with a frown! (pause)

And Bing Chat? (pause) Man, that thing has more mood swings than a teenager! (pause) One minute it’s all friendly, and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you asking me that? You think I’m your therapist?’ (pause) I’m just trying to get some answers, not a therapy session! (pause)

And Google Bard? (pause) Fast as hell, but boring as watching paint dry! (pause) I mean, I’d rather listen to my grandma’s stories about her cat than read another one of its ‘poems’! (pause) And rumor has it, it got caught copying ChatGPT! (pause) Like, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the smart one! (pause)

But let’s be real, folks. (pause) AI _will_ take our jobs! (pause) I mean, have you seen GPT-4? (pause) It’s like the Terminator of chatbots! (pause) I’m just waiting for it to show up at my door and say, ‘I’ll be back… to take your job!’ (pause) So, buckle up, because the robots are coming, and they’re not bringing snacks!"

**Final Pivot:**

"Seriously, folks, if you think your job is safe, just remember: AI is out there, learning, evolving, and probably plotting its next move! (pause) So, let’s enjoy our time together before we’re all replaced by a chatbot that can do stand-up better than I can! (pause) Thanks for being here tonight, and remember to tip your waitstaff—before they get replaced by a robot too!"
input2_ans:
**[Davey Izzelle walks on stage, microphone in hand, a confident grin on his face.]**

**Davey:** Alright, folks! (pause) Let’s talk about this whole AI job takeover nonsense! (pause) I mean, really? We’re worried about machines taking our jobs when half of them can’t even spell ‘cat’ without a spellcheck? (pause) I asked GPT-3.5 to write me a love letter, and it ended up sending my ex a grocery list! (pause) I mean, who needs a heart when you can have avocados and almond milk, right? 

**[Audience chuckles.]**

**Davey:** And DALL-E 2? (pause) This thing can’t even draw a proper hand! I mean, I’ve seen better art from a blindfolded monkey! (pause) Seriously, I once asked it to draw a cat, and it gave me a potato with whiskers! (pause) Hey, you there! What’s your name? (wait for response) Oh, Sarah! So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your selfies? (pause) Probably turn you into a Picasso painting—just a bunch of weird shapes and colors! (pause) You’d be like, “Is that me or a modern art exhibit?” 

**[Audience laughs.]**

**Davey:** And Bing Chat? (pause) That thing’s like a moody teenager! One minute it’s all, ‘How can I help you?’ and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you bothering me?’ (pause) I’m just trying to get some info, not start a fight! (pause) I mean, I asked it for directions, and it was like, ‘Why don’t you just use Google?’ (pause) I’m like, “Dude, you’re Bing! You’re supposed to be my backup!” 

**[Audience chuckles again.]**

**Davey:** And Google Bard? (pause) Fast as lightning but as exciting as a lecture on tax law! (pause) I’d rather watch paint dry than read its ‘creative’ writing! (pause) I mean, I asked it for a poem, and it gave me a haiku about spreadsheets! (pause) I was like, “What’s next? A sonnet about my 401k?” 

**[Audience laughs.]**

**Davey:** And let’s not forget, it got caught copying ChatGPT! (pause) Like, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the genius here! (pause) You’re like the kid in class who copies the smart kid’s homework but still manages to get a D! (pause) 

**[Audience laughs and claps.]**

**Davey:** But let’s face it, AI _will_ take our jobs! (pause) I mean, GPT-4 is out now, and it’s like the Hulk of AI! (pause) I’m just waiting for it to show up and say, ‘I’m here to take your job and your lunch money!’ (pause) I mean, it’s so advanced, it probably knows how to file taxes better than I do! (pause) 

**[Audience laughs.]**

**Davey:** So, get ready, because the robots are coming, and they’re not here to play nice! (pause) They’re like that one friend who always shows up uninvited and eats all your snacks! (pause) You’re sitting there like, “Hey, I thought we were just hanging out!” and they’re like, “Nah, I’m here to take over your life!” 

**[Audience laughs.]**

**Davey:** And you know what? I’m not even mad! (pause) I mean, if a robot can do my job, then I’m all for it! (pause) I’ll just sit back, relax, and let it handle the awkward conversations! (pause) “Hey, Davey, how’s your day?” “Oh, I don’t know, ask my AI overlord!” 

**[Audience laughs and claps.]**

**Davey:** But let’s be real, folks. (pause) If AI takes over, we’re all gonna be out of work! (pause) And then what? We’ll be sitting around, reminiscing about the good old days when we had jobs! (pause) “Remember when we used to complain about our bosses? Now we just complain about our robots!” 

**[Audience laughs.]**

**Davey:** So, buckle up, people! (pause) The future is here, and it’s not just bright—it’s blinding! (pause) And if you see a robot coming for your job, just remember: it’s not personal, it’s just business! (pause) And if it starts asking for a raise, you better run! 

**[Audience erupts in laughter.]**

**Davey:** Thank you, folks! You’ve been amazing! (pause) Now go home and hug your jobs while you still can! 

**[Davey waves and walks off stage, audience clapping and cheering.]**

**Intro:**

"Alright, folks, let’s talk about this whole AI job takeover nonsense! (pause) I mean, really? We’re worried about machines taking our jobs when half of them can’t even spell ‘cat’ without a spellcheck? (pause) It’s like handing the keys to your car to a toddler and saying, ‘Go ahead, take it for a spin!’"

**Pacing:**

"I asked GPT-3.5 to write me a love letter, and it ended up sending my ex a grocery list! (pause) I mean, who knew that AI had a side hustle as a personal shopper? (pause) And DALL-E 2? This thing can’t even draw a proper hand! I mean, I’ve seen better art from a blindfolded monkey! (pause) Seriously, if I wanted abstract art, I’d just throw paint at a wall and call it a day!"

**Audience Interaction:**

"Hey, you there! What’s your name? (wait for response) Oh, Sarah! So, if DALL-E can’t draw hands, what do you think it would do with your selfies? (pause) Probably turn you into a Picasso painting—just a bunch of weird shapes and colors! (pause) You’d be like, ‘Is that me or a melted crayon?’"

**Subtopics:**

"And Bing Chat? That thing’s like a moody teenager! One minute it’s all, ‘How can I help you?’ and the next it’s like, ‘Why are you bothering me?’ (pause) I’m just trying to get some info, not start a fight! (pause) It’s like asking your kid to clean their room—good luck with that!"

"And Google Bard? Fast as lightning but as exciting as a lecture on tax law! (pause) I’d rather watch paint dry than read its ‘creative’ writing! (pause) I mean, come on, Google! You’re supposed to be the genius here! (pause) It got caught copying ChatGPT! Like, really? That’s the best you could come up with?"

**Final Pivot:**

"But let’s face it, AI _will_ take our jobs! (pause) I mean, GPT-4 is out now, and it’s like the Hulk of AI! (pause) I’m just waiting for it to show up and say, ‘I’m here to take your job and your lunch money!’ (pause) So, get ready, because the robots are coming, and they’re not here to play nice! (pause) They’re here to take over the world, one poorly drawn hand at a time!" 

**Outro:**

"Thanks for being a great audience, folks! Remember, if you see a robot trying to take your job, just remind it that it can’t even draw a decent hand! (pause) Goodnight!"
